intro: Micromeria pilosa, commonly known as the hairy micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, round fruits are usually green when mature and contain a single seed. Micromeria pilosa is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
